name: Fairmont Le Montreux Palace

reviews.text: I stayed here March 6th and 7th, 2007, and it was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms amazing. Please get a room with a view. Well worth every penny. I sat on the balcony over looking the water and had coffee. Has every amenity you could imagine. Large ,marble bathroom with towel warmers, and thick robes. The bed was extremely comfortable with a wonderful down comforter. Staff was very nice. I would not stay anywhere else in Montreux.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: A very beautiful hotel with great service but unfortunately it's dated and lacks people and atmosphere.
reviews.title: Dated and empty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best hotel in Western Switzerland. On arrival, the receptionist was very efficient, the concierge was very helpful (we had a problem with lost luggage and they dealt with this very efficiently and made us feel that they were dealing with it and we didnt have to think about it).
reviews.title: Worth Every Penny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean and spacious, we had a junior suite overlooking lake geneva. The bathroom was immaculate and well stocked with nice toiletries. The turndown service in the evening was provided. Prices in the minibar were reasonable (for a five star hotel).
reviews.title: Grand Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, service was efficient, good variety on buffet. Excellent variety of fruits, yoghurt, breads, pastries, cold meat, cheese and cereals. Freshly squeezed fruit juice was delicious. There is a chef in the dining room who can cook your eggs to order. This is unusual in Switzerland (even in five star hotels).
reviews.title: Money well spent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back with my wife from a weekend break at the Palace in Montreux. Having read the reviews here I had great expectations, which unfortunately were not met entirely.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but some serious draw-backs

likes.liked: — It's a typical Grand Hotel of the old school
likes.disliked: — The main restaurant & bar was closed during August

reviews.text: I booked a deluxe room, which turned out to be a rather small corner room under the roof on the 6th floor, with no balcony. On arrival we were told that the piano bar as well as the main restaurant (Jaan) were closed. The staff was on holidays for over two weeks and that in August! Due to bad weather the outside locations (Harry's Terrace and terrace on Petit Palace) were also closed. Although the lobby is huge, nobody sat there. Probably because there was no service! We had to go to the reception to order some drinks!
reviews.title: Stunning Views
Back in Montreux was great
reviews.text: The hotel itself is great, but almost too large. Considering the age (100yrs) it's in good shape.
However, a real treat is the sunday brunch. The variety and quality of the food is fantastic. That made up for the rest.
reviews.title: The best hotel on the Swiss Riviera
Home Away From Home
reviews.text: We flew into Geneva and the coach transfer was about an hour to the hotel. Montreux is beautiful set at the side of Lake Geneva and the hotel was great, the staff were friendly and the food was good (we only had breakfast there as we were out every evening)

aka: Fairmont Le Montreux Palace Hotel Montreux
description: Art Nouveau Hotel set on the shore of Lake Geneva, 300 meters from train station.
